definitions.definition: The staying together, or remaining in close relation , of non-physical things .
examples: Her performance has lacked consistence over the last year.
This composer’s musical work is of extraordinary consistence .

definitions.definition: The physical quality which is given by the degree of density , firmness , solidity , and viscosity ; consistency .
The condition of adhering or standing together, or being fixed in union , as the parts of a body ; coherence , existence , firmness, solidity.
That which stands together as a united whole ; a combination .
Standing still ; quiescence , state of rest .

secondary_definitions: The staying together, or remaining in close relation , of non-physical things .
( archaic ) The physical quality which is given by the degree of density , firmness , solidity , and viscosity ; consistency .
( obsolete ) The condition of adhering or standing together, or being fixed in union , as the parts of a body ; coherence , existence , firmness, solidity.
( obsolete ) That which stands together as a united whole ; a combination .
( obsolete ) Standing still ; quiescence , state of rest .
( obsolete except poetic ) A substance which adheres together.
